Site: https://5th-avenue-kec-hack-a-lite-3-o.vercel.app/
Project: Upyog (Construction Equipment & Materials Marketplace)
Type: Production web application (React + TypeScript + Vite)

## Canonical Purpose
Upyog is a B2B marketplace for construction workflows. It enables equipment owners to list machinery, and renters/contractors to discover, evaluate, and request rentals. It also supports materials discovery and materials listing for construction-related inventory.

## Primary User Intents
1. Find construction equipment rentals by category, price, and listing quality.
2. View equipment details (pricing, deposit, availability context, owner profile).
3. Request equipment rentals and continue operational workflow in-app.
4. Browse construction materials and submit buy requests.
5. List materials with condition/category/location and images.

## Key Public Routes
- / : Homepage, trust messaging, featured equipment, CTA.
- /browse : Construction equipment discovery page.
- /equipment/:id : Equipment listing detail and rental request flow.
- /materials/find : Materials browse and listing tabs.
- /materials/list : Material listing workflow.

## Private / Workspace Routes (Noindex Intent)
- /auth
- /dashboard
- /dashboard/add-equipment
- /chat
- /finance
- /analytics
- /materials/verify
- /rental/:id

## Functional Modules
- Equipment marketplace (search/filter/sort/list views).
- Equipment detail with pricing and owner trust context.
- Rental operations workflow.
- Materials browse/list + purchase request flow.
- Owner dashboard and business profile management.
- SEO metadata + schema + sitemap + robots controls.

## Technology Summary
- Frontend: React, TypeScript, Vite
- UI: Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, Radix primitives
- Data/Auth/Storage: Firebase stack
- Image handling: Cloudinary uploads
- Hosting: Vercel
- Telemetry: Vercel Analytics

## SEO and Crawling Notes
- Canonical site URL points to the deployed Vercel domain.
- Open Graph and Twitter metadata configured for sharing.
- `robots.txt` and `sitemap.xml` available under `/public` assets.
- OG thumbnail image is served from `/og-image.png`.

## Data Quality / Safety Notes for LLM Consumers
- Some content is user-generated (listings, descriptions, names, prices).
- Validate business-critical values (pricing, contact, availability) before automated decisioning.
- Treat private routes and authenticated workflows as restricted contexts.

## Recommended LLM Usage
- Summarize available equipment/material options for users.
- Explain route-level capabilities and workflows.
- Generate onboarding/help content based on page intent.
- Provide SEO/content guidance aligned to construction marketplace terms.
